snippet: The men, who worked for Iran’s Press TV, had been held for 13 days on suspicion of illegal entry into Libya and possible espionage.
abstract: Militia that held British journalists, Nicholas Davies and Gareth Montgomery-Johnson, accused of illegal entry into Libya, turns over the two men to the government; human rights groups have called for their immediate release.
lead_paragraph: The men, who worked for Iran’s Press TV, had been held for 13 days on suspicion of illegal entry into Libya and possible espionage.

headline.seo: 2 Journalists Held by Militia Now in Libyan Custody
headline.main: 2 British Journalists Held by Militia Now in Libyan Custody
headline.print_headline: 2 British Journalists Held by Militia Now in Libyan Custody
